column4: Hi folks, can anyone suggest why my flash player (the Adobe one) is extremely buggy?  It stops, starts, hangs and occasionally crashes Firefox.  I'm running an up to date vanilla Ibex install; the only change is that I boot the kernel with noapic as my hardware doesn't play nicely with APIC.
sudo apt-get --purge remove flashplayer-nonfree (and all other flash players you have installed)
then sudo apt-get clean then go to a site with flash, it will be offered to you
I'll give that a try - I had tried the troubleshooting page from the FAQ, but got nowhere
having a load of flash stuff installed can confuse stuff
you could try nspluginwrapper which can help
that's it sorted, thankyou; turns out I was using swfdec instead of the Adobe player.  Duh.
add an entry in te startup item to run the script
if you copy it to /usr/bin then you don't need to specify the full path
So I just copy the executable script to that folder without specifying a path?

no, if you put the script in /usr/bin you will be able to call it without having to type ~/Desktop/scriptname when you want it, just like you dont use full path names for the commands you use like apt-get and cp
